intro: Pedicularis mariae, commonly known as the Mary's lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to red. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. Due to its specialized habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
